com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm

Interface ModelFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SqliteModelFactory

    public interface ModelFactory

    This interface provides an API for creating new instances of model classes from ORM query results. It's important to note that model classes must contain an empty, parameterless constructor in order for these methods to work since Object construction is done using reflection. If no such constructor is present, a ModelConfigurationException will be thrown at runtime.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 02/20/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T createFromResult(ResultSet result, java.lang.Class<T> modelClass)
      Constructs a domain model instance and populates its fields from the given ResultSet.

    • Method Detail

      • createFromResult

        <T> T createFromResult(ResultSet result,
                     java.lang.Class<T> modelClass)
                   throws ModelConfigurationException,
                          InfinitumRuntimeException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a domain model instance and populates its fields from the given ResultSet. The precondition for this method is that the ResultSet is currently at the row to convert to an Object from the correct table.
        Parameters:
        result - the ResultSet containing the row to convert to an Object
        modelClass - the Class of the Object being instantiated
        Returns:
        a populated instance of the specified Class
        Throws:
        ModelConfigurationException - if the specified model Class does not contain an empty constructor
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the model could not be instantiated
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the ModelFactory implementation cannot process the ResultSet type
